meanings.definition: An instance of a batter being put out by hitting a ground ball that is fielded by a defensive player and thrown to first base before the batter reaches it.
meanings.sent1: The batter's groundout ended the inning quickly.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated after the groundout secured the win.
meanings.sent3: The groundout was like a sudden stop in the game's flow.
meanings.sent4: Her groundout was a swift conclusion to the play.
meanings.sent5: The crowd groaned at the batter's unfortunate groundout.

meanings.definition: To make an out in baseball by hitting a ground ball that is fielded by a defensive player and thrown to first base before the batter reaches it.
meanings.sent1: He groundouted after a solid hit to the infield.
meanings.sent2: The player groundouts often due to his powerful hits.
meanings.sent3: She groundouts with determination every time she's up to bat.
meanings.sent4: The team hopes he doesn't groundout in this crucial moment.
meanings.sent5: Groundouting is a common occurrence in baseball games.
